title.narrative: Addressing Cluster Munition Contamination Through the Effective Use of Technology

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to support the mine action response to cluster munition contamination in eastern Cambodia through the deployment of clearance teams and the improvement of technologies used to identify and remove these items. To achieve this goal, MAG will deploy one Explosive Ordnance Disposal team, one Battle Area Clearance team and one Non-Technical Survey team to release 778,260m2 of land, conduct 566 spot tasks, and remove a total of 1,885 items of UXO and other ERW, to the benefit of 2,489 people. Overall, activities under the grant will accomplish greater efficiency and productivity of clearance teams by supporting HDR&D- funded research and development activities with regards to improved deep search UXO detection systems.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity

sector.narrative: Conflict Prevention and Resolution/Peace and Security
